sub_title: Physical Security Officer at US Army
summary:
In the belief that your organization is looking for a motivated professional with a strong work ethic, high order of attention to detail, investigational experience and exceptional leadership and administrative skills, I have enclosed a résumé for your review and consideration.
As an energetic leader with great initiative, elite personal drive, and a disciplined work ethic, I have had the privilege and honor of serving my country in challenging leadership capacities in the United States Army. I have pointed out some key contributions made in the past that would directly benefit your organization today— and tomorrow. I offer you the following: 
•	Solid leadership experience encompassing many facets of global law enforcement and security operations, Investigations, anti-terrorism and force protection (ATFP), physical security, resource protection, workforce training and development, and international and public relations 
•	Proven operations, fiscal management, personnel management, employee relations, and customer service achievements 
•	A professional style; highly personable and outgoing; a proactive team leader/player 
•	Strong quality management professional, focused on cost-effectiveness, productivity, and continuous improvement 
•	Seasoned strategic planning, program development, instructional, and problem-solving skills 
•	Endowed with exceptional communication and motivational skills - proactive in bringing together large groups of diverse people working toward the accomplishment of common goals 
My academic preparation includes a Bachelor degree in General Studies with a minor on Business and a minor in Criminal Justice. Throughout my career in the U.S. Army, I successfully completed many advanced professional training academies, schools, undergraduate-level courses, and seminars. 
As reflected in my résumé, my experience and skills sum up my ability to learn quickly, perform a variety of managerial and administrative tasks and responsibilities, resolve problems and conflicts, communicate effectively, and use good sense in planning and organizing operations for optimum efficiency. My work ethic, motivation and loyalty are unmatched and will serve your organization well. 
I am particularly interested in learning about positions you may have available for an individual with my qualifications. With this in mind, I welcome the opportunity to schedule an interview. 
Thank you for your time and consideration. Respectfully submitted, 
Samuel Larregui

education.field_of_study: General Science with a minor in Busines Administration

awards.title: Defense Meritorious Service Medal
awards.description: For exceptional meritorious service while serving as the Force Protection/Antiterrorism & Senior Training Noncommissioned Officer for North Atlantic Treaty Organizations.  Responsible for the security of 19,000 personnel from over 30 different nations.

awards.title: Army Achievement Medal
awards.description: For outstanding Achievement for developing and enforcing emergencies procedures for the Military Police and security personnel during the COVID-19 pandemic.  His dedication to duty and capabilities to see ahead of the curve enable the Supreme Headquarters Allied Pacific Europe (SHAPE) command and Emergency Service to continue operations without interruptions.

profile_positions.description:
• Masterfully served as the Antiterrorism and Force Protection (AT/FP) Operation Manager, Allied Command Operations (ACO), SHAPE, responsible for planning, coordination and execution of antiterrorism, force protection, and internal security operations within and surrounding the installation.
• Developed and disseminated SHAPE physical security and operational security policies, procedures and security requirements including Force Protection 
• Served as a Subject Matter Expert for processing theater clearance for NATO personnel, working with 30 different nations with multiple standards and requirements. 
• Effectively led a team of 47 multinational personnel, responsible for the integration and training on physical security, OPSEC, document security, first responders and law enforcement for the Provost Marshal’s Office maintaining all mission, training, and policies requirements.  
• Coordinated all VIP visits and special events access to the installation to include, back ground checks, issuing of security badges, coordination with installation security, and host nations law enforcement personnel
• Managed the performance evaluations system and facilitated the applications and process for common access cards for International Supervisors without access to the US Army Evaluation Entry Systems
profile_positions.title: Security Representative and Senior Trainer Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Led, trained, and professionally developed 35 noncommissioned officers and 67 junior enlisted Soldiers of a Military Police Detachment consisting of 101 Soldiers; responsible for the overall readiness of the detachment to include Army Warrior skill training, Noncommissioned Officer Professional Development, physical fitness, and law enforcement operations; managed unit administration (Human Resources); responsible for enforcing high stands of discipline, duty performance, and professional development; responsible for equipment worth over 15 million; responsible for the morale and welfare of Soldiers and their families; senior advisor to the Detachment Commander with the command and control of the detachment.
• Recognized by Battalion Commander as the number one organization out of five with the highest moral, enforcing equal opportunity, sexual harassment free zone and maintained an environment of safety for 365 days with no drug/alcohol/safety related incidents; awarded a gold streamer for excellence
profile_positions.title: Detachment Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for all company training schedules, calendars, and briefings, ensured all training requirements and logistical support were highlighted and forecasted; managed 10-managers and 41-junior personnel 
• Provided the senior director with statistical data required to determine the unit’s 24/7 deployment readiness 
• Maintained all unit level training records, tracked mandatory training and monitored database for 163 personnel 
• Efficiently scheduled and assigned patrol and special duties to shift personnel and/or made amendments as needed to ensure optimum scheduling of work assignments in order to provide maximum protection for all installation resources
profile_positions.title: Operations Sergeant

profile_positions.description:
• Served as a Senior Drill Sergeant in One Unit Station Training company responsible for individual training, supervision, and development of 240 initial Entry Training soldiers per 17 weeks cycle
• Responsible for ensuring that the standards are met to provide the U.S. Army wit disciplined, physically and morally fit Soldiers, competent in warrior core task and military police mission requirements. Coordinates and integrate logistics, maintenance, and safety in all operations
• Responsible for the accountability, supervision, professional development, and evaluation of 12 Drill Sergeants 
• Responsible for the training of 720 Initial Entry Training Soldiers per year, as well as accountability, serviceability of individual and organizational equipment valued excess of $400,000
profile_positions.title: Senior Trainer (Drill Sergeant)
